title: Login to server pop.windstream.net with username ----- failed
creator: pegp
content:
In the past month or two I have been dealing with a constantly recurring issue with Thunderbird getting my emails. Login to server pop.windstream.net with username ----- failed, and then it gives me the option to retry, enter new password, or cancel. 99% of the time, when I hit retry, my email downloads just fine. But I have multiple email accounts that I have to go through the same song and dance on every time I try to download my messages. Sometimes one or more of my email addresses will check and download ok... sometimes all of them will... sometimes none of them will. But choosing the retry option usually yields me good results so it doesn't appear that I have something in my settings that is wrong?? And usually if I shut down of Thunderbird and a restart of it, all email addresses will down;load perfectly the first time I try.

I wonder if it doesn't correlate with a Thunderbird update? I keep hoping that the issue will be resolved as quickly as it came through another update or something but it's been long enough to really start driving me crazy now so can you help me? What is going on with the normally smoothe and agreeable Thunderbird on my very same computer using the very same email addresses all of a sudden?

title: Thunderbird not displaying emails in Gmail Inbox
creator: bhardy1954
content: Emails were not appearing in the Thunderbird (v128.11.0esr (64-bit), on a Windows 10 laptop) Inbox from a newly opened Gmail account (though they did appear in All Mail). The Gmail account was opened with default options, and it was added to Thunderbird with default options. They did appear in the Gmail app on an Android phone, but with the label 'Primary' rather than 'Inbox'. Investigation of Gmail accessed via a web browser showed that the Inbox contained four tabs: 'Primary', 'Promotions', 'Social' and 'Updates'. Doing Get started with Gmail > Customize your inbox > Default > Customize allowed me to "Deselect all categories to go back to your old inbox". This didn't fix Thunderbird (even though I forced a Get New Messages for) but, after I'd blundered around a bit more, it started working. So, I'm not sure whether I did something else to fix it, or it just took several minutes to start working. Also, the Android phone now shows 'Inbox' rather than 'Primary'. Question: Is there a way of sorting this out at the Thunderbird end, without having to make setup changes at the Gmail end? It would be very useful if Thunderbird could sort this out automatically when we add a Gmail account. Until then, it would be useful if your solution or, if no solution, my work-around could be publicised in Help. Thank You
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:139.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/139.0;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/manual-account-configuration"]

title: Context menu for messages changed in v128
creator: MikeZZ
content:
Windows 10, latest version on desktop computer.

In all previous versions I was able to open an email from the list in table view (or card view) by right clicking and selecting open message in new tab, window or conversation right from the top 3 choices, now I have to slide over to a sub menu to do the same thing. Why the change? Plenty of space for the 3 options unless you are on a phone and that's a different app. I'm told Windows 11 has some of the same changes making you have extra clicks for something that was 1 click hurting your productivity.

Otherwise this version is an improvement since it opens the program faster and some things seem more responsive similar to the versions many years ago that did not have as many features.

title: Thunderbird's junk learning
creator: peter368
content:
I've been using Tbird for many years for multiple accounts, and I have the junk filter turned on so it's supposed to learn when I mark a message as junk. But I have noticed recently that even when I mark messages as junk, if more of the same come in, they don't get caught by the filter as they ought to be.

  1. Is there a limit after which the filter no longer learns?
  2. It's the same filter, no matter how many accounts, right?
  3. If I UNmark a message accidentally marked as junk, does it reverse that pattern in the filter?
  4. If I highlight a group of unmarked messages and mark them all junk, does it learn from them?

Peter

title: Global search only shows one of each pair of identical emails
creator: BillSparrow
content:
For historical reasons that are intentional (forwarding at the ISP level) I regularly receive the same email into two of my email accounts (call them account A and account B). When I perform a global search only one of each pair of identical emails is listed.

If I delete the email that shows up, and then repeat the global search, the results now include the other copy of the email that was previously not displayed.

This proves that both copies have made it into the Gloda (the global index) but the filtering of the results is hiding duplicate emails.

If this is "works as intended", then I am happy with that, but I am curious about two things...

1. When account A and account B contain duplicate emails, it is somewhat random whether the one in account A or the one in account B is hidden. However, I rebuilt the global index yesterday, and after that, a global query with duplicate emails showed all the ones from account A and hid all the ones from account B. Today, after receiving more duplicate emails, the duplicates of today's emails in account B are displayed and those in account A are hidden. I am wondering what defines which gets hidden.

2. What is being checked to discover that two emails are identical? Looking at the message source I see that although the message bodies are identical, the headers are wildly different for the most part. Is it perhaps checking the "Message-ID:" line of the header?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/136.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;kb_visits_prior:["/en-US/kb/open-search"]

title: Thunderbird keeps trying to log into a removed account.
creator: chris-hayes
content:
Problem:

You remove an account like Google from Thunderbird, but Thunderbird continues to repeatedly show a pop-up to log into that account (in my case Google). I've noticed it even freezes the Thunderbird UI on startup.

Note: I'm self-answering this question. Mozilla Support has similar questions, but they're archived with incomplete answers. By archiving them, Mozilla is preventing the community from improving the solutions on those problems.

This exact question has been asked at least 4 different times, and it's been archived with 4 different solutions. All of them are valid advice.

  • "Check your calendars" - https://support.mozilla.org/mk/questions/1441082
  • "Check your addons" - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1208183
  • "Check your addressbook" - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1440106
  • "Check troubleshooting info" - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1398233
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:139.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/139.0

title: Outlook Email and Calendar Sync. Version 138 vs 139
creator: james.a.hill
content:
I just purchased a new laptop and am trying to get Thunderbird up and running. I have an outlook email account and use it's calendar. On my previous laptop (manjaro linux) I ran Thunderbird version 138.0 which allowed me to install TBSync and customize via the chrome file. It worked great at bringing the calendar over to Thunderbird. Now, on my new laptop (also Manjaro Linux) the package manager is only presenting version 139+ to install but TBSync does not work on this version of Thunderbird and I can't figure out how to install Thunderbird version 138 on the new laptop.

So, I need help either syncing my calendar in thunderbird version 139 to my outlook account or on how to install thunderbird version 138 so I can add TBSync. I've downloaded the file for version 138 but don't know how to install it. This shouldn't be so difficult.

Your assistance is greatly appreciated.
metadata: ;solver_id:6776958;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/137.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

title: trouble moving large batches of email to local folders
creator: rwsuth12
content:
So my microsoft office365 email account that I access with Thunderbird is almost full (think 100,000 messages), and I would like to move those messages off of the server and into local folders as backup. I've done this in the past and, while it would be cumbersome and slow, it would eventually work.

Now though, I can't seem to move more than 5-10 messages at a time to a local folder. That isn't helpful with so many emails to process! When I try larger batches, the program just balks, no error message, no emails moving, just nothing. In the past the emails would move, but then it would take ages for the mail server to catch up. Now it just isn't trying.

Any help would be appreciated!
